body: What should be the SQL version of `OR => []`? Would something like `OR FALSE` work?

@markstory honestly, I don't know. There is nothing after the WHERE.

I've tried the failing query I get from my app with `WHERE 1 = 1 OR 1 = 1;` to make it work. This query can be executed.
We could also skip adding the condition if the `OR` clause will be empty instead of adding an impossible statement. That better emulates how `orWhere()` would have worked.

You mentioned that you reached this case through the marshaller. Is there a way to reproduce that scenario in our test suite?

I don't think that raising an exception from `$table->find()->where(['OR' => []])->all()` is going to resolve the problem your facing. I think those conditions are one of many ways to create invalid SQL by asking for bad queries to be generated. Instead I'd like to fix the scenario leading to that bad query being asked.

I'm not sure I would need the proprietary code, are you able to reduce down what you have into something that can reproduce the issue without all the proprietary code?

I tried last night to define a hasmany association that uses append for the save strategy, and wasn't able to figure out how to get `$value` to be an empty list here https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/blob/1cfebf6c6719a2a743d9a3e59ee091a726f18844/src/Database/Dialect/TupleComparisonTranslatorTrait.php#L57-L82
@markstory I believe we should treat empty conditions a empty. We already do that for a broad variety or expressions with no conditions.

issue.title: Fix empty QueryExpression objects being converted as SQL

repository.name: cakephp
repository.description: CakePHP: The Rapid Development Framework for PHP - Official Repository

issue.body:
Using the `or_()` function already produced and enpty expression object
when passed an empty array. It makes sense to do the same when using the
equivalent array notation

fixes #12081

body: Closing as there is a pull request open now.
